name: Littio
headline: Dollar banking for people in Latin America
description: Littio is a neobank focused on solving the currency devaluation problem for Latin Americans. The product offers a Savings Account, a Mastercard debit, and investing options in U.S. dollars to help people avoid the currency risk.

founders.name: Luis Huertas, Founder
founders.description: Luis is the Co-Founder & CEO of Littio, a fintech startup that building dollar-backed financial services for Latin America. Luis is also a mentor for Endeavor for LATAM and an angel investor.

founders.name: Camilo Jimenez, Founder
founders.description: CTO at Littio. Previously CTO & cofounder of GDX.travel (Acquired by Hopper). Born in Colombia.

founders.name: Christian Knudsen, Founder
founders.description: Chris is the Co-founder & President of Littio. He leads growth with over a decade of experience scaling tech startups and leading growth across multiple industries, including fintech, agriculture, and web 3.0.

founders.name: Ivan Torroledo, Founder
founders.description:
Physics & Economist 
Data Scientist 
+9 banking & financial services experience

generated_description:
Littio is a dynamic neobank founded in 2021, based in Bogotá, Colombia, and is part of Y Combinator's Batch W23. Its mission? To create a robust dollar banking solution for people in Latin America, aiming to tackle the pervasive issue of currency devaluation in the region.

Littio offers a suite of financial products designed to safeguard users from currency risks. These include a USD savings account, a Mastercard debit card, and various investment options in U.S. dollars, allowing customers to manage their finances with greater stability and ease. Imagine being able to receive, transfer, and even grow your capital while minimizing exposure to local currency fluctuations.

With a team of 28 talented individuals, Littio is not just another fintech player; it's a solution crafted specifically for the needs of the Latin American populace. The platform is tagged under the fintech and crypto-web3 sectors, indicating its forward-thinking approach that blends traditional banking with the emerging blockchain technologies.

Their offerings are straightforward: you can open a USD account in just five minutes, send and receive payments seamlessly, and access your funds through a variety of means, locally or internationally. For those who travel or work internationally, the Littio Mastercard allows easy purchases and cash withdrawals without the usual excessive fees.

What's more inspiring is the traction Littio is gaining. They've already attracted over 13,000 users looking to manage their finances more effectively, and they've garnered significant backing from influential investors, including founders of major startups. 

Bottom line? Littio is redefining finances for anyone engaged with Latin America, providing tools to navigate economic challenges with confidence. If you're interested in avoiding the pitfalls of currency risk, check them out at [Littio](https://www.littio.co/).
